page.title: 06TRADE - THE MARKET
page.content: In{Hucknall}we have had a busy colourful{market}since{1874}which is held every Friday.There are about{50 {stalls}selling mainly fruit and vegetables and clothing but one stall sells fresh fish from Grimbsby,one sells jewellery and another plants fom a local gardener.Many years ago there used to be a chip stall which cooked chips in a big open iron pot over a brazier.It was brought to market on some type of wheelbarrow.One person mainly runs each stall.Many travel from{Nottingham}and {Leics,}some from Yorks.Most stallholders go to other markets as well.One has been coming to Hucknall for 33 years.
